title: Windows server 2019 + IIS10 + windows authentication + Mozilla.
content: I have a stange problem when I use windows authentication with Mozilla. I have a web-site that is deployed on IIS 10 and IIS 10 is on WIndows Server 2019. My web-site uses windows authentification under the hood. It works normally about 2 minutes and after that requests aren't sent to web-server(IIS 10). And web-server logs 401.2 error. I guess that browser and web-server loses connection, but I don't know why. If we speak about other browsers like Edge, Chrome etc they work normally. May be is it neccessary to configure Mozilla or web-server(IIS 10) specifically?
creator: dolmatovich.nikita

title: Was not able to access my Firefox browser.
content: Firefox was gone from my taskbar and could not access previous site with all my saved info. Had to download new browser, but have none of my old info. And what happened to it all?
creator: sharri.black

title: Make links open in oldest window instead of the newest
content: I normally just use a single firefox window but occassionally when I have multiple monitors I turn one tab (usually youtube) into a new window and put it on my second monitor. The problem is I want all new links to continue open on my original/main window but firefox keeps opening them in the new window. Is there a way to change this behaviour?
creator: login19

title: Propaganda do ADD BLOCK
content: Bom dia, uso o Firefox há muitos anos, recentemente não paro de receber um add TODAS as vezes que uso o navegador com uma propaganda do ADD BLOCK, ele faz SEM PARAR justamente o que ele está vendendo como solução, inacreditável!! Como posso interromper isso? Já tentei e nõa consegui, estou a ponto de mudar de navegador. Atenciosamente, Beatriz

title: websites in WordPress do not work like in Chrome
content: Hi, Websites in Word Press that have a video background do not work properly and do not play the video. In Chrome it's OK. Example: yaronimo.pl
creator: jarojk1

title: Secure Connection Failed On One Computer, but Not Others
content:
I'm running into a very strange issue where on my personal computer, I'm unable to log in to the below website, receiving a "Secure Connection Error." I know normally, this would be a certificate issue on the website's side, but in this case, I don't believe it is. The issue being is I can access the site using Firefox on both my phone and other computers just fine. It just appears to be my desktop having the issue.

Are there any recommendations for fixing this issue? I've attempted clearing browser history, doing fully clean installs of Firefox, other browsers, shutting off my VPN, and DNS flush.

To note: this is a SSO site for logging into Opera products - in my case GameMaker Studio 2. I was, at least, able to login a few weeks ago. I'm using Windows 11, currently fully updated as of writing this. I'm using NordVPN, but so are other systems that allow me to sign in.

https://id.gamemaker.io/account/opera_sso (redirects to auth.opera.com)
creator: dpeterssk

title: Invasive icon on  my mac toolbar
content: I have this invasive purple Firefox icon that state that "firefox is capturing your screen". I hate it because it looks suspicious. I need it disabled and completely off. Otherwise, I have to get firfox uninstalled from my computer. I can't have something that I don't have control over. unacceptable.
creator: cisselamine2002

title: Network Protocol Error
content: I recently started getting these messages on only a few site, but the list is growing, I am not computer smart and will not go into any setting because I usually end up needing a new computer. Why is this happening. I have no problem just using another browser, this is stupid

title: 错误代码：PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR
content:
连接到 advertising.amazon.de 时发生错误。PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR

错误代码：PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR
creator: wonder_journey

title: Full screen video does not fill screen horizontally Mac
content:
When I watch fullscreen videos in another browser (Chrome, Safari, etc.) on my Mac the video fills the entire screen. For some reason when doing the same in firefox the video does not reach to fill the entire screen and instead only occupies the middle. I tried screenshotting to illustrate this behavior but the screenshot was restricted to this middle zone as well. It seems like somehow firefox is shrinking the display size when no other browser exhibits the same behavior.

It also seems like if I want I can drag the video window around in fullscreen moving the whole video player around my display. I shouldn't have to drag the thing around to get the video to play right.
creator: theawesomepandapig

title: Firefox cannot play IMDB video. It shows: This video file cannot be played error code 224002
content:
Firefox cannot play IMDB video. It shows: This video file cannot be played error code 224002 Youtube and other video contents are working fine but IMDB. Chrome and other browsers are playing IMDB video without any issue. Why Firefox does not? Is there anyone who knows how could I solve this problem?

Thank you!
creator: jager.akos

title: All attempts to install addons returns "Installation aborted because the add-on appears to be corrupt."
content:
I'm at a loss here, problem is in subject line. This has happened for a long while and has persisted through various versions, I have attempted to:

- Alter my antivirus and internet protection settings to allow as much traffic as I can. - Download addons as XPInstall files and try and use the File -> Open File option in the Menu Bar - only returns a line about not having permission, despite having Admin permission.

My Firefox Version is the current 118.0.2 (see: attached image).

Thanks in advance.
creator: Stoneflower
